newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska fed cattle market quiet, very light -USDA.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska fed cattle market quiet, very light -USDA.

text.p: Trading on slaughter steers and heifers was quiet following large weekly movement of 109,000, USDA said. Some buyer inquiry evident, and few cattle traded steady; but selling side has already completed their week's work and showlists mostly depleted.

Despite the sessions large sales volume, trade members continue to expect ample available supplies through the coming weeks. Live basis sales - Equivalent 3 percent shrink delivered and FOB, some FOB 4% shrink. Dressed basis delivered ( paid on hot carcass weights).

Slaughter Steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1150-1225 lbs - few 109.00- 110.00. Slaughter heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 1050-1125 lbs - few 109.00- 110.00. Confirmed - 400 Last Week - None Last Year - 5,400 For week - None. Sm Pd Lst Wk - None. Sm Pd Lst Yr - None
